Package au.csiro.pathling.fhirpath.unit

Interface FhirPathUnit

All Known Implementing Classes:
CalendarDurationUnit, UcumUnit
public sealed interface FhirPathUnit permits UcumUnit, CalendarDurationUnit
Represents a FHIRPath unit of measure, which can be either a UCUM unit, a calendar duration unit, or a custom unit from another system.

This sealed interface has three permitted implementations:

  • UcumUnit - UCUM (Unified Code for Units of Measure) units
  • CalendarDurationUnit - FHIRPath calendar duration units (year, month, week, etc.)

Units can be converted between compatible types using the convertValue(java.math.BigDecimal, au.csiro.pathling.fhirpath.unit.FhirPathUnit, au.csiro.pathling.fhirpath.unit.FhirPathUnit) method, which converts values for both same-type conversions (UCUM-to-UCUM, calendar-to-calendar) and cross-type conversions (calendar-to-UCUM, UCUM-to-calendar) where applicable.

  • Method Details

    • system

      @Nonnull String system()
      Gets the system URI for this unit (e.g., UCUM system URI, calendar duration system URI).
      Returns:
      the system URI

    • code

      @Nonnull String code()
      Gets the canonical code for this unit (e.g., "mg", "second").
      Returns:
      the unit code

    • isValidName

      boolean isValidName(@Nonnull String unitName)
      Validates if the given unit name is a valid representation for this unit. The validation rules depend on the unit type:
      • For UcumUnit: the name must exactly match the code
      • For CalendarDurationUnit: the name must match either the singular or plural form (e.g., "year" or "years" for YEAR)
      Parameters:
      unitName - the unit name to validate
      Returns:
      true if unitName is valid for this unit, false otherwise

    • convertValue

      @Nonnull static Optional<BigDecimal> convertValue(@Nonnull BigDecimal value, @Nonnull FhirPathUnit sourceUnit, @Nonnull FhirPathUnit targetUnit)
      Converts a value from one unit to another, supporting same-type conversions (UCUM-to-UCUM, calendar-to-calendar) and cross-type conversions (calendar-to-UCUM, UCUM-to-calendar) where applicable. Handles both multiplicative conversions (e.g., mg → kg) and additive conversions (e.g., Celsius → Kelvin).

      Cross-type conversions work by finding intermediate representations:

      • Calendar → UCUM: Converts this calendar unit to seconds, then seconds to UCUM equivalent, then performs UCUM-to-UCUM conversion to target
      • UCUM → Calendar: Converts source UCUM to seconds equivalent, then performs calendar-to-calendar conversion from seconds to target

      Examples of valid conversions:

      • UCUM → UCUM: 1000 mg → 1 kg
      • UCUM → UCUM (additive): 0 Cel → 273.15 K
      • Calendar → Calendar: 1 day → 24 hour
      • Calendar → UCUM: 1 millisecond → 1 ms
      • UCUM → Calendar: 60 s → 1 minute

      Conversions return empty when:

      • Units measure incompatible dimensions (e.g., mass vs volume)
      • Non-definite calendar units are involved in certain conversions
      Parameters:
      value - the value to convert
      sourceUnit - the source unit to convert from
      targetUnit - the target unit to convert to
      Returns:
      an Optional containing the converted value if conversion is possible, or empty if the units are incompatible

    • fromString

      @Nonnull static FhirPathUnit fromString(@Nonnull String unit)
      Parses a unit string and creates the appropriate FhirPathUnit instance.

      The parsing strategy is:

      1. First attempts to parse as a calendar duration unit (year, month, week, day, hour, minute, second, millisecond - both singular and plural forms)
      2. If not recognized as a calendar duration, assumes it's a UCUM unit code

      using their constructor with both system and code parameters.

      Examples:

      • "year" → CalendarDurationUnit.YEAR
      • "seconds" → CalendarDurationUnit.SECOND
      • "mg" → UcumUnit with code "mg"
      • "unknown-unit" → UcumUnit with code "unknown-unit" (may fail on conversion)
      Parameters:
      unit - the unit string (e.g., "year", "seconds", "mg", "kg")
      Returns:
      a FhirPathUnit instance (CalendarDurationUnit if recognized, otherwise UcumUnit)
